DOC.brief_summary: This three-year award pilot-test innovative intervention , Resilient , Empowered , Active Living Diabetes ( REAL ) , target underserved minority young adult poorly-controlled diabetes . The individually tailor , community-based intervention merges find in-depth need assessment , principles evidence-based occupational therapy intervention ( Lifestyle Redesign® ) evidence-based diabetes self-management strategy . A proof-of-concept study demonstrate REAL feasible implement , acceptable young adult type 1 diabetes type 2 diabetes , potential produce positive change diabetes self-care glycemic control . The study randomize 80 young adult diabetes receive either six-month REAL intervention attention control condition . Blinded data collector assess glycemic control , diabetes self-care behavior quality life outcome , well potential intervention mediator , six-month intervention . It anticipate finding pilot study use inform large-scale randomize control trial REAL intervention . The study 's specific aim hypothesis follow : Aim 1 . Determine intervention 's efficacy primary outcome : glycemic control diabetes self-care . Hypothesis : At 6 month ( immediately follow intervention ) , intervention group participant demonstrate improvement A1C diabetes self-care compare control group participant . Aim 2 . Conduct exploratory analysis intervention 's impact secondary outcomes potential mediating mechanism ( inform power estimate large-scale RCT ) . Hypothesis 1 : At 6 month , intervention group participant demonstrate improvement secondary outcome : diabetes-related stress quality life , depression , life satisfaction compare control group participant . Hypothesis 2 : At 6 month , intervention group participant demonstrate improvement potential mediator intervention : habit strength , problem solving , activity participation , self-efficacy diabetes knowledge compare baseline . Aim 3 . Conduct process evaluation utilize mixed method evaluate refine intervention delivery ( e.g . treatment fidelity , patient satisfaction ) study procedure ( e.g . recruitment , retention , test protocol ) .
DOC.brief_title: Resilient , Empowered , Active Living : REAL Diabetes Study
DOC.criteria: Diagnosed type 1 type 2 diabetes mellitus minimum 12 month Most recent A1C ≥8.0 % Fluent English Spanish Reachable telephone text message Willing participate study activity Reside Los Angeles County plan relocate Pregnant planning become pregnant Cognitive impairment severe disability limit life expectancy Participated lifestyle intervention target diabetes within past 12 month Participated formative research relate intervention development .
